definition: Ouyang Xiu (1007-1072), Northern Song dynasty prose writer and historian
(used for transliteration)/old variant of 謳|讴[ou1]
Europe/abbr. for 歐洲|欧洲[Ou1 zhou1]/surname Ou
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
surname Xiu
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: Ouyang Xiu Systematize ZhengXuan's sub-system of poems in a systematic order.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳修还对郑玄《诗谱》的世次体系进行了系统整理。

sentences.english: The status of Ouyangxiu, in the history of politics and literature, has been defined.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳修在历史和文学上的地位，几乎已有定论。

sentences.english: Ou-yang Xiu was a man of great importance in shaping the literati culture of the Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 欧阳修在宋代士大夫新文化的型塑过程中极具影响力。

sentences.english: Huang Zongxi's orthodoxy was formed under the influence of Ouyang Xiu.
sentences.chinese: 黄宗羲的正统论受到欧阳修的影响。

definition: Su Zhe (1039-1112), Northern Song writer and calligrapher, one of the 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of the 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Wang Yucheng (954-1001) Song dynasty literary figure
Wang Anshi (1021-1086), Song dynasty politician and writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Fan Zhongyan (989-1052), minister of Northern Song who led the failed reform of 1043, author of On Yueyang Tower 岳陽樓記|岳阳楼记
Huang Tingjian (1045-1105), Song poet and calligrapher
Zeng Gong (1019-1083), Song dynasty writer, one of the Eight Giants 唐宋八大家
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
Su Xun (1009-1066), Northern Song writer of prose, one of the Three Su 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and also one of Eight Giants 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 ba1 da4 jia1]
Song Qi (998-1061), Song dynasty poet and writer, coauthor of History of the Later Tang Dynasty 新唐書|新唐书
Liu Yuxi (772-842), Tang poet
Su Dongpo, another name for Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼 (1037-1101), northern Song writer and calligrapher
Lu You (1125-1210), widely regarded as the greatest of the Southern Song poets
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Liu Yong (987-1053), Song poet
Cai Xiang (1012-1067), Song calligrapher
